page.title: 15Talk of Laggan.
page.content: It is now quite some time since Laggan was bi-lingual i.e.speaking English & Gaelic.Everyone now communicates the spoken and written word in English.Due to economic restraints,Gaelic has not been taught in the village school for 10 years, but is still encouraged and taught in Kingussie High School.The last Gaelic speaking resident died in 1979.There is no dialect as such but conversation contains local phrases "my hands are starved"-"my hands are cold" or-"what gutters!"-"what a lot of mud!"Occasional Gaelic words will always prevail-----"Oichde mhath" "Good-night"
